{"step_by_step_thinking": "Acute Rheumatic Fever is a disease that has several manifestations. According to the Jones Criteria mentioned in Document [0], major manifestations of Acute Rheumatic Fever include carditis, polyarthritis, chorea, erythema marginatum, and subcutaneous nodules. Therefore, chorea and subcutaneous nodules are recognized manifestations of Acute Rheumatic Fever. However, abdominal pain and epistaxis are not mentioned in any of the documents as recognized manifestations of Acute Rheumatic Fever.", "answer_choice": "D. ab"}
